My main areas of practice include:  medical/legal
I am an Occupational Therapist registered and in good standing with the Alberta College of Occupational Therapists (ACOT)
column2: the Canadian Association of Occupational Therapists (CAOT) and the Society of Alberta Occupational Therapists (SAOT).  I have practised Occupational Therapy since graduating from the University of Manitoba
column4: School of Medical Rehabilitation with a Bachelor of Medical Rehabilitation in Occupational Therapy (BMR OT) in 1999.  I have worked in Saskatchewan
column5: British Columbia and Alberta. I have more than 18 years’ experience in completing Functional Capacity Evaluations
column8: in-home assessments and ergonomic evaluations (specializing in office ergonomics).  I have completed post-graduate continuing education requirements for certification as a Functional Capacity Evaluator from WorkWell (then known as Isernhagen) in May 2000 and as a Certified Ergonomic Evaluation Specialist (CEES) from Matheson in April 2013. I have completed the Life Care Planning course and Cost of Future Care & Functional Testing: Preparing Defensible Life Care Plans from Matheson in October 2013 and May 2016 respectively.  I have completed numerous functional and ergonomic examinations for insurance companies
column9: law firms and employers.  I have assessed numerous individuals to determine their functional abilities and limitations for medical-legal purposes.
